info.title: Temando API
info.description: Providing consumers with more choice and lowering the cost of shipping.

post.summary: Create a Product object in the account.

attributes.description: This is the schema for representing product's attributes.

merchantProductId.description: The product unique identifier, provided by the merchant

unitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure that describes the product. Should be a value from Measures column at https://www.ups.com/worldshiphelp/WS12/ENU/AppHelp/Codes/Unit_of_Measure_Codes_for_Invoices.htm

dimensions.description: This is the schema for representing dimensions

unitOfMeasurement.description: The distance unit the dimension's properties are in

value.description: The value of the weight unit

unitOfMeasurement.description: The weight unit the value is

monetaryValue.description: This is the schema for an representing money

currency.description: The currency the money amount is

isPrePackaged.description: Whether the product has its own package

canRotateVertical.description: Whether the product can be rotated vertically

countryOfOrigin.description: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 compliant two-letter country code.

countryOfManufacture.description: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 compliant two-letter country code.

classificationCodes.description: Classification codes of this product for export.

scheduleBinfo.description: Classification code for exporting goods out of the United States.

hsCode.description: Harmonized Commodity Description and Coding System.

customerReference.description: A consistent identifier that represents a clients customer

address.description: This is the schema for representing an address

isOrganisation.description: Does this address belong to an organisation?

countryCode.description: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 compliant two-letter country code.

postalCode.description: The post or zip code of this address.

locality.description: The locality (i.e city, township) of this address. Some countries do not use this field; their address lines are sufficient to locate an address within a sub-administrative area.

dependentLocality.description: The dependent locality (i.e neighbourhood) of this address. When representing a double-dependent locality in Great Britain, includes both the double-dependent locality and the dependent locality,

administrativeArea.description: The administrative area of this address, ie. state.

longitude.description: The longitude value of a geocoded address.

latitude.description: The latitude value of a geocoded address.

contact.description: This is the schema for representing entity

phoneNumbers.description: List of phone number(s) of this entity

nationalIdentificationNumber.description: National identification number of this entity, ie. INSEE code (France)

taxIdentificationNumber.description: Tax identification number of this entity, ie. TFN (Australia), TIN (France)

address.description: This is the schema for representing an address

isOrganisation.description: Does this address belong to an organisation?

countryCode.description: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 compliant two-letter country code.

postalCode.description: The post or zip code of this address.

locality.description: The locality (i.e city, township) of this address. Some countries do not use this field; their address lines are sufficient to locate an address within a sub-administrative area.

dependentLocality.description: The dependent locality (i.e neighbourhood) of this address. When representing a double-dependent locality in Great Britain, includes both the double-dependent locality and the dependent locality,
